newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds ease in calm and cautious market.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds ease in calm and cautious market.

text.p: Argentine bonds were slightly lower in a very calm market in early trading Monday, with attention focused on Tuesday's speech before Congress by U.S. Federal Reserve chief Alan Greenspan, dealers said.
"The market is very calm, with very thin volume," a dealer for one major local bank said.
Dealers said the high volatility seen last week, on fears that Brazil might devalue its real currency, was over.
"This is the calm after the storm," he said. "There is wide consensus now both in the international and domestic markets that Brazil will not devalue the Real."
He added that Argentine bond spreads were very wide and there may still some way down to go Monday and Tuesday.

The FRB Brady bond due 2005 was slightly lower a $93.75 after having closed Friday at $93.875 while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 was trading at at $118.20 against a previous close of $118.25.
